text: You need CMS enterprise for this though… any other ideas?
You could instead deploy the function to AWS lambda (literally the same platform that runs the HubSpot function) and it would only cost a couple of cents a day

when I log `hs logs results` I get this error:
```2023-05-24T14:51:33.048Z - UNHANDLED_ERROR - Execution Time: 1660msRuntime.ImportModuleError: Error: Cannot find module '@HubSpot/api-client'```
do I need to add that to my package.json? I thought it was automatically available

So you would host the “app” on HubSpot CMS just for authentication and then host all your functions on AWS Lambda?

Are there any tutorials for hosting functions on AWS? Or if you meant authenticating and hosting an app through AWS, is there a tutorial on that?
